intro: Auriculardisia baruana, commonly known as the Bornean ear-leaf tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Borneo. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often adorned with ear-like projections, giving it its scientific name. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
